definition: a moment/a while/in a moment/also pr. [yi1 hui3]
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])
a moment/a while/in a moment/now...now.../also pr. [yi1 hui3 r5]
erhua variant of 等一會|等一会[deng3 yi1 hui4]

sentences.english: This class will be over in a moment, now let's take a nap(break , catnap).
sentences.chinese: 本课时将近结束，大家可以休息一会儿。

sentences.english: Horses should be walked for a while after a race.
sentences.chinese: 比赛后，应让马慢走一会儿。

sentences.english: This class will be over in a moment, now let's take a nap(break , catnap).
sentences.chinese: 本课时快要竣事，各人可以休息一会儿。

sentences.english: Presently she started up, exclaiming that they wouldbe late for breakfast;
sentences.chinese: 不一会儿她跳了起来，嚷着他们要耽误早饭了。

sentences.english: In the evening I enjoyed the hot pot with my friends.
sentences.chinese: 晚上又和朋友打了一会儿火锅。
不一会儿，一辆捄护车到了。

sentences.english: Soon, the villa came the dull sound of dogs barking a few.
sentences.chinese: 不一会儿，别墅里传出数声沉闷的狗叫声。

sentences.english: Let me actually get rid of that for just a moment.
sentences.chinese: 我们先去掉那个一会儿。

sentences.english: I'll take a rest at this teahouse.
sentences.chinese: 那我就先在这家茶楼休息一会儿。

sentences.english: When the inebriated elk was freed, it lay for a while on the ground, seemingly unconscious.
sentences.chinese: 当“醉鬼”获救后，它在地上躺了一会，昏迷不醒。

sentences.english: It seemed that they walked down that hill-slope for a long way, but perhaps it was a short way;
sentences.chinese: 他们似乎在山坡上走了很久，但也许只有一会儿。

sentences.english: After the waitress arrived with our food, we ate in silence for a time.
sentences.chinese: 女招待端来了我们的晚餐，我们默默地吃了一会儿。

sentences.english: Good - bye, Gian Battista. Kiss the little ones for me . Good - bye, Teresa.
sentences.chinese: 那天下午亚瑟感到有必要多散一会儿步。

sentences.english: On my way home I stopped at my aunt's.
sentences.chinese: 回家途中我顺便到姑妈那儿去了一会儿。

sentences.english: For a moment he reflected on how much he loved this godson.
sentences.chinese: 一会儿，他仔细想他多么爱这个教子。

definition: a moment/a while/in a moment/now...now.../also pr. [yi1 hui3 r5]
half of the day/a long time/quite a while/midair/CL:個|个[ge4]
a while/a spell/a short time/a burst
erhua variant of 等一會|等一会[deng3 yi1 hui4]
to catch and hold on/to continue/to go on to do sth/to follow/to carry on/then/after that/subsequently/to proceed/to ensue/in turn/in one's turn
to get up/to leave/to set forth
interjection indicating approval, appreciation or agreement
it's not important/it's nothing/never mind/to have nothing to do/to be free/to be all right (out of danger or trouble)
